profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T18:18-0400

did.unittitle: Meteorological observations made for the Franklin Institute, 1839-1865
did.abstract: These items contain observations made at Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. The entries for January 1860-September 1865 are duplicates. One series was made under the direction of the Smithsonian Institution and is on the printed forms supplied by that institution. With this are: 2 memoranda by Michael, undated; 2 broadsides, Pennsylvania College of Gettysburg. Order of exercises; April 15, 1851; and Smithsonian institution. Registry of periodical phenomena...

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift from Lutheran Theological Seminary, Mount Airy, Pa. (Margaret J. Hort), and accessioned, 1958 (1958 1621ms).

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This collection is also available on microfilm (Film 1467, Reel 1).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Michael Jacobs was a Pennsylvania Lutheran clergyman and educator; he taught mathematics and natural sciences at Pennsylvania (now Gettysburg) College, 1832-1866.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: A bound notebook that contains detailed meteorological observations from Gettysburg, Pa.
